name: To react, or not to react/Kick-starting a react project with create-react-app
description:
12:00 ‚Äì 13:00

a lecture "To react, or not to react" by Valeriy Krupenin and Deniss Muhla (Stream Labs). The discourse will include the following topics: 1. Why to use, or not to use React. 2. Short overview of basic principles and ideas of React. 3. Comparing React with other frameworks (jQuery, angular).

13:00 ‚Äì 18:00

A workshop "Kick-starting a react project with create-react-app" by Pavels¬†Jelisejevs (C.T.Co). The workshop will give you a quick tour on how to quickly start a new React project using create-react-app. We'll have a look at the structure of the project, walk through all of the features that are available out of the box and write some kind of cool app. By the end of the workshop you'll have hands-on experience with React as well as some other tools from its ecosystem.

About our speakers:

Valeriy Krupenin: "I'm web developer, mostly working on front-end side. For more then a year now, I'm using React in enterprise web apps UI development, and I consider it as "must have" skill and technology in modern web development."

Deniss Muhla: "Software engineer and passionate follower of new web technologies. Love to write code on JS also know well C#. Don't fear of webpack, redux and isomorphic web applications. Can work as backend and/or frontend developer."

Pavels¬†Jelisejevs: "I'm a full stack web developer, but my current preference lies with the client side. I enjoy making complex things easy and this is why React is the technology of my choice."

name: Lecture: Practical Prototyping
description:
Our speaker: Gleb Revkov ‚Äî a lead UX/UI designer at C.T.Co

Effective collaboration between developers and designers has often been a challenge. Several aspects of software, like interactivity, animation or business requirements can be elusive by nature and therefore difficult to validate before they are actually built. Through many years of experience, we have found a way to build the bridge between both groups. And that bridge are prototypes. In this talk I‚Äôm going to share my experience with ‚ÄúPrinciple‚Äù prototyping tool and demonstrate how designers and developers can perform cost-effective software iterations before a single line of production code has been written.

For whom is this lecture?

If you are a developer passionate about UX/UI design or UX/UI designer itself, this lecture is exactly for you!

name: Women TechMakers Season Opening
description:
If you are interested to get started with IT, don‚Äôt miss Women TechMakers season events in Daugavpils!¬†

At the opening you will be provided with full information about all cool activities we are planning for you, that includes meetups with inspiring stories of women in technology and workshops where you will build websites and mobile apps by your own!

As well at the opening event we will show you a movie ‚ÄúCodeGirl‚Äù about teenage girls from across the Globe who dream to build a mobile app and win in the Technovation Challenge competition to receive $10K to complete the development of their apps.

The aim of the project is to show that programming or any other IT field can be fun and exciting, as well to practice English, because if you wish to work in IT that will be your working language (but, please, don‚Äôt worry, if you feel that your English is not good enough, Latvian and Russian can also be used). Everyone is welcome to attend, but ladies are specially invited.¬†

name: Get inspired and welcome to IT
description:
We have invited 2 awesome and successful IT specialists. As we are inspired by their professionalism and motivation, we are sure their talks will be inspiring for you too and will encourage you to learn programming, be interested in technologies and excel!

Our great speakers:

Jelena Revzina

has started her career as a web developer, but now she is a computer network engineer at Runway BPO company. She lectures ‚ÄúComputer Network‚Äù and ‚ÄúComputer Network Security‚Äù at the university. In 2012 she has got Cisco Women in Networking Award in Europe and in[masked] Cisco Expert Level instructor excellence.

Helena Plesanova

has started an IT career as project manager, business analyst and SEO specialist in website and e-commerce startup. Later she became a tester and specialises in functional, integration, performance and penetration tests for 7 years. As well she is GDG Daugavpils team member.

Our speakers will talk about their jobs and what makes them to be motivated.

Language: LV/RU

This event is one of Women TechMakers Season in Daugavpils events. We promise to empower you learn coding, be interested in IT and help to start your career in IT. Join us, such events never happened in Daugavpils before!

name: WORKSHOP: learn how to create simple webpages
description:
Do you want to learn how to create simple webpages?

This event is for you:

- If you are naturally curious and want to know how do web pages look like under the hood,

- If you want to develop front end and don't know how to start,

- If you plan to use site builders like wix.com or wordpress.com but need to know HTML and styling basics to customize your project,

- Or if you want to spend Saturday productively in nice company and learn new things

We will:

- learn theory basics of HTML and CSS,

- practice and write our own HTML tags and style them,

- Explore styling power of Bootstrap,

- Embed various things into page as fancy fonts, videos from youtube or map from google maps.

No programming experience required. Just bring your laptop and enthusiasm!

üë©‚ÄçüíªWorkshop will be held in English and led by front end developer Alina Karpeƒºceva.

We are going to have short lunch at the venue.

name: Women in tech inspire! WTM event
description:
Join Google Developer Group Daugavpils meetup on December 2 at 13:00 to learn and get inspired about technology! Location: Daugavpils Mark Rothko Art center.

What awaits you?

Inspiring and educational stories of frontend web developer Jurga and Tech team lead Vida. Both of them are from well known and successful startups. Our awesome speakers will share the insights of their jobs, what makes them motivated and why technology is great!

More about speakers

Jurga is a frontend developer who works at Oberlo, one of the most successful startups in Lithuania. She is co-founder of Vilnius Girls Code - Lithuanian community of woman who loves coding.

Vida is B2B Product Lead at Trafi, which works with the biggest map companies in the world. Her international experience at the huge corporations and a startup combines a lot of colorful insights about the ladies in the male dominated industries.

The reasons why you can‚Äôt miss it

‚Ä¢ If you are naturally curious and want to know who are frontend developers, tech team leads and what they do.

‚Ä¢ If you want a career in technology, but need advices where to get started.

‚Ä¢ If you want to meet people who are passionate about technology as you are.

‚Ä¢ If you just want to spend good time on Saturday!

Language: English

Our speakers and we would be very happy to see you there!

name: How to create a mobile app? WTM event
description:
Have you ever wondered how to write a mobile app? Is it as easy as some people say? Let‚Äôs find out together!

In this event we will:¬†

- learn about basic parts that make up any Android app;

- learn some Kotlin - official and awesome programming language for Android development;

- create a Christmas themed app to have hands-on experience.

Programming experience is not required, but it will be an advantage.¬†

Please bring:

- laptop with Android studio installed (d.android.com/studio);

- Android phone and USB wire to connect it to your laptop.

Workshop could be held in English/Latvian/Russian (depending on attendee preference) and led by Sergejs Luhmirins - Android developer at FullContact Latvia.

Register:¬†

https://gdgdaugavpils1.typeform.com/to/rvw8Ne

After the registration we will send you the location of the event and more information.

P.S. We follow "ladies first" principle : )

name: Self-organizing map ‚Äî the first step to Machine Learning
description:
‚Ä¢Registration:
https://gdgdaugavpils1.typeform.com/to/to2T6e

‚Ä¢ What we'll do
During the workshop we will build a self-organizing map that is a popular algorithm of clusterization based on Competitive learning. The algorithm is described with principles of artificial neural networks. It is perfect for analysis of multidimensional data structures and ideal as the first step into Data Mining. Building your own Self-organizing map will help you to understand the principle of this method in detail and experience how parameters influence the result. We will use VBA to build and experiment with a network.

‚Ä¢ What to bring
A Laptop (can be one for two) with MS Excel installed with support for Developing mode (you can analogue Excel, but at your own risk), minimal programming skills.

name: Learn how to create simple webpages (WTM event)
description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Do you want to learn how to create simple webpages?
Register: https://gdgdaugavpils1.typeform.com/to/vfjHs4

This event is for you:
- If you are naturally curious and want to know how do web pages look like under the hood,
- If you want to develop front end and don't know how to start,
- If you plan to use site builders like wix.com or wordpress.com but need to know HTML and styling basics to customize your project,
- Or if you want to spend Saturday productively in nice company and learn new things üòä

We will:
- learn theory basics of HTML and CSS,
- practice and write our own HTML tags and style them,
- Explore styling power of Bootstrap,
- Embed various things into page as fancy fonts, videos from youtube or map from google maps.

üë©‚Äçüíª Workshop will be held in English and led by front end developer Alina Karpeƒºceva.

‚Ä¢ What to bring
No programming experience required.
For the workshop:
- download Atom code editor (https://atom.io/)
- bring your laptop and enthusiasm!

‚Ä¢ Important to know
üçïWe are going to have short lunch at the venue.

We will send you a confirmation email with the workshop details few days before the workshop.

All ladies will be accepted to the workshop, even if they register late : )

The event is supported by US embassy in Latvia.

name: Google I/O 2018 Daugavpils
description:
–ú—ã –ø–æ–∫–∞–∂–µ–º –ø—Ä—è–º—É—é —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ª—è—Ü–∏—é —Å –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ Google I/O, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥–µ—Ç –≤ –°–∞–Ω –§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü–∏—Å–∫–æ. –í—ã —Å–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ —É–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –æ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö –æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞—Ö –∏ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è—Ö Google, –Ω–æ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ ‚Äî –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –î–∞—É–≥–∞–≤–ø–∏–ª—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ò–¢ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞! –¢–∞–∫ –∂–µ –º—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º —Ä–∞–∑–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å—É–≤–µ–Ω–∏—Ä—ã Google I/O.

This event will bring Daugavpils developer community together to watch Google I/O keynote livestream.
We are going to share a lot of I/O swag (t-shirts, stickers etc.). Join us!!!

Google I/O is an annual developer conference held by Google in San Francisco, California. I/O showcases technical in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open sources such as Android, Chrome and Chrome OS, APIs, Google Web Toolkit, App Engine, and more.

name: JavaScript for beginners. WTM event
description:
‚ùóApply here: https://gdgdaugavpils1.typeform.com/to/lpJ8tO

üíªThis workshop is for people without any programming experience. Knowing HTML, CSS is a big plus but not obligatory.
At this workshop you will learn not only JavaScript-specific things but also concepts present in other programming languages. So even if you decided to learn PHP or C++ in future but don‚Äôt know any basics, this JS workshop still can be valuable to you!

Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôll learn:
üìå What is JavaScript (JS). Where you can write it and use it.
üìå Variables
üìå Basic operations with variables (arithmetic, boolean)
üìå Conditionals
üìå Functions
üìå Loops
üìå DOM API
üìå Accessing webpage through code
üìå A bit of HTML and CSS

We will code something interesting together! There are prepared tasks with ready HTML and CSS, to which we will add some interactivity with JS and will see what happens.

Language: mostly English, but our mentors can explain everything in Latvian or Russian :)

üë©üèª‚ÄçüíªThe workshop will be led by front end developer Alina Karpeƒºceva.
üçïwe will have light lunch on spot sponsored by supporters
üíªThis workshop is free for everyone, but ladies are especially invited!

It is organized by GDG Daugavpils and supported by United States Embassy - Riga, Latvia LIAA Daugavpils biznesa inkubators and Riga TechGirls

name: Daugavpils Developers meetup
description: The mission of Daugavpils Developer meetup is to serve the needs of local developer community providing space for knowledge sharing, learning, teaching and networking. It is going to be a regular gathering for discussing tech related topics. Everyone is welcome to propose their own interesting topic. However the main topic for the next event is "Tips for successful developers career".

name: Tech Talks: Testing & Functional Programming
description:
We are back after summer holiday and happy to announce a new meetup! It is going to be two technical talks about testing and functional programming.

#1:Integrating Testing in Agile Development
by Kristaps Cerminieks

About the talk: In this presentation I will show you importance of Testing from the very beginning of Development all the way till Product Release and further on. Necessary Tests processes for healthy and stable product.
About Kristaps: QA Engineer / Lead with multi-project experience working with both small and large scale companies. Experience in testing Video Streaming Services, Communication Client Applications, Transportation search engines, Health Apps and more. Multiple Project experience with different Agile Teams. Test Process implementation in both early and late development stages.

#2:Functional programming Traps & freeks
by Roman Stanczewski

About the talk: In recent years, the functional programming paradigm has become popular. A short report about how you can rip your project.
About speaker: Android developer in Citadele banka.
Graduated from the Institute of Transport and communications. Taught mobile development and functional programming in TSI.

name: Workshop: Intro to Go & Docker
description:
Ever dreamed to try Go and Docker but haven't got time for this? This is your chance!

Speaker: Sergey Kibish (https://sergeykibish.com)
Time: 3.5h
Level: Entry
Language: English/Russian

During this workshop you will have hands-on experience writing application (web server and CLI app) in Go. Additionally we will get familiar with Docker. Finally you will see benefits of using these tools together and separately.

Need to bring:
- Laptop
- Good mood :)

Preparation:
- Go is installed for you platform (https://golang.org/doc/install)
- Docker CE is installed for your platform(https://docs.docker.com/install/)
- Text editor of your choice is installed. Suggestion is to install Visual Studio Code (https://code.visualstudio.com/). It has decent Go language and Docker plugins (and it's free).

Need to know:
üçïwe will have light lunch on spot sponsored by supporters
üíªThis workshop is free for everyone
